text:
Some conference deadlines coming up, where someone/a team might want to submit a talk about contributing translations:
• ConectaR (Spanish-speaking, ~online~ Costa Rica): <https://congresos.ucr.ac.cr/event/7>. Conference 8-9 March (presentations on Sat 9 March). Abstract deadline 10 Feb. Registration cost USD 100 standard, USD 70 student (there is a early bird discount before 15 Feb).
• useR! 2024 (English), Salzburg, Austria or online: <https://events.linuxfoundation.org/user/>. Conference 8-11 July. Abstract deadline 10 March. Registration cost EUR 750/500/250 industry/academia/student standard (early bird discount before 31 Feb). 
Unfortunately I haven't seen anything about diversity scholarships for useR!, I think they have found it hard to secure sponsors. There are tentative plans for a Dev Day on 12 July after useR! in Salzburg, but again funding is not confirmed and if we get it, may only be for venue and catering on the day. So at the moment assume attendance in person will require self-funding. If someone is able to attend in person and present, that would probably be best, as they could engage with people during the rest of the conference/at the Dev Day.

text: I'm planning to attend useR! 2024 in person and super happy to help with anything related to the above idea, e.g. making screenshots or contributing to a talk in other ways; helping out at a workshop; if someone can only do the talk remotely, I can act as the in-person ambassador of her/him etc -- but I cannot take a lead, as I already had another talk in mind for the CfP
